oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Skip Ewing - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews Skip Ewing (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of July 10, 1988. The episode is part 1 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Skip Ewing
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Skip Ewing Pulsebeat show -- (00:40) Your Memory Wins Again (Skip Ewing) -- (03:32) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (03:48) Spangler asks Ewing what the inspiration behind "I Don't Have Far to Fall" was -- (05:23) I Don't Have Far to Fall (Skip Ewing) -- (08:24) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (08:45) Spangler asks Ewing to request a song -- (09:10) Moonlight in Vermont (Willie Nelson) -- (12:26) Spangler inquires if "The Gospel According to Luke" came from real life experiences -- (14:01) The Gospel According to Luke (Skip Ewing) -- (17:28) Ewing reflects on what his family thought of his musicial career -- (18:35) Spangler asks Ewing to perform a tune -- (18:45) The Coast of Colorado [Live] (Skip Ewing) -- (22:23) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Ewing, Skip;
